discworld

Class CityCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • discworld.CityCard

  • public class CityCard
extends Object
    This class generates the city cards and owner of the city areas
    Version:
    2.00, 12 March 2015
    Author:
    Shu Liu, Mohit Pujara

    • Constructor Detail

      • CityCard

        public CityCard(int id,
                String name,
                byte[] nearestCity,
                int benefit)
        Constructs an instance of CityCard class with the given parameters. This constructor will create a particular CityCard with the id, the name and the nearest cities to it.
        Parameters:
        id -
        name -
        nearestCity -
        benefit -

      • CityCard

        public CityCard(int id,
                String name,
                int owner,
                Vector<Integer> minions,
                boolean troublemaker,
                boolean building,
                int demons,
                int trolls,
                byte[] nearestCity,
                int benefit)
        Constructs an instance of CityCard class with the given parameters. This constructor will create a particular CityCard with id, name. the owner, number of minions for each player, existence of trouble maker and building, number of demons and trolls
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the city
        name - The name of the city
        owner - The owner of the city
        minions - Vector of minions records the minions for each player
        troublemaker - Contains trouble maker or not
        building - The city has build or not
        demons - The city has demons or not
        trolls - The city has trolls or not
        nearestCity - Adjacent cities to the given city
        benefit - The benefit a player can have by having a building at that city

    • Method Detail

      • putMinion

        public boolean putMinion(Player p)
        The method put the minions in the game.
        Parameters:
        p - The player whose minions is put in the city.
        Returns:
        If the player put a minion then return true, otherwise return false.

      • removeMinion

        public boolean removeMinion(Player p)
        This method is used for removing one minion for a player.
        Parameters:
        p - The player whose minions is removed
        Returns:
        If the player' minions is removed then return true, otherwise return false.

      • putTM

        public boolean putTM()
        If there is no trouble maker in the city, then put one. Otherwise, output trouble maker exists
        Returns:
        If trouble maker is put, then return true, otherwise return false.

      • removeTM

        public boolean removeTM()
        If there is a trouble maker in the city, then remove it. Otherwise, output trouble maker does not exist.
        Returns:
        If trouble maker is removed, then return true, otherwise return false.

      • build

        public boolean build(Player p)
        If there is no building in the city, then build one for the player and change the owner for the city. Otherwise, output building exists.
        Parameters:
        p - The player who want to build a building.
        Returns:
        If building is built, then return true, otherwise return false.

      • destroy

        public boolean destroy()
        If there is a building in the city, then destroy one for the player and change the owner for the city. Otherwise, output building does not exists.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        If one building is destroyed, then return true.
